intro: Trichosanthes kerrii, commonly known as the Chinese snake gourd, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, pumpkins, and gourds. The plant produces large, green, elongated fruits that can grow up to 1 meter in length. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals and are either male or female. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture.
